title: Total US Jobs Lost to AI as % of Labor Force
description: Projected net jobs eliminated by AI and automation as a share of the total US civilian labor force (~167 million), accounting for both direct displacement and partial task automation that eliminates full roles.

sources.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
sources.excerpt: 300 million full-time jobs globally could be exposed to automation; translates to roughly 3-5% net US job losses after accounting for new job creation.

sources.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2023: AI and the Labour Market
sources.excerpt: 27% of jobs are in occupations at high risk, but actual displacement depends on adoption speed and policy response.

sources.title: Gen-AI: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work
sources.excerpt: Almost 40% of global employment is exposed to AI; in advanced economies, roughly 60% of workers face some degree of AI impact.

sources.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
sources.excerpt: AI may increase TFP by only 0.53-0.66% over 10 years; limited net job losses of ~2% as many affected tasks are only partially automated.

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2024
sources.excerpt: Employers expect 23% of jobs to change in the next five years, with a net decline of 2-4% of total roles once job creation offsets displacement.

sources.title: AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030
sources.excerpt: Forrester estimates 6% of US jobs will be lost to AI and automation by 2030, partially offset by new job creation.

sources.title: AI exposure predicts unemployment risk
sources.excerpt: Workers in AI-exposed occupations face significantly higher unemployment risk, suggesting aggregate job losses may exceed earlier estimates.

sources.title: We're not ready for mass AI unemployment
Bureau of Labor Statistics Employment Projections 2024-2034
sources.excerpt: BLS projects moderate net displacement with significant variation across occupational groups.

sources.title: S&P 500 AI-Related Layoff Disclosures — Aggregate Analysis
sources.excerpt: Analysis of 2024 10-K filings: 47 S&P 500 companies disclosed AI-driven workforce restructuring. Cumulative disclosed headcount reductions: ~185,000 positions.

sources.title: US Job Postings Are 15% Below Peak — AI Categories Hit Hardest
sources.excerpt: Data entry (-27%), customer service (-18%), and basic admin (-22%) postings saw steepest declines. AI/ML postings +42% YoY.

sources.title: C-Suite Survey on AI and Employment: Early Evidence
sources.excerpt: Survey of 2,500 C-suite executives finds 90% report no significant net employment impact from AI adoption as of Q3 2025, though task reallocation is widespread.

sources.title: Challenger Report: 55,000 AI-Attributed Layoffs in 2025
sources.excerpt: Employers cited AI as a direct cause for 55,000 job cuts in 2025, concentrated in customer service, data entry, and back-office operations.
